topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a91e5863687264ec000bc1#post_55a91e5863687264ec000bc1

First of all, _never_ play Sims on a non-PC console. EA is lazy and you will get shit.

Two, what the fuck? Usually the towns have stories, but it's really up to the player to fulfill them and make them up as they go along. You mean there was, like, an actual story path?

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a91ec763687237e2002be7#post_55a91ec763687237e2002be7
Yeah. An actual beginning, middle and end of a story for The Sims 2. And I also played the PS2 version of it too, which is more like the PC version in that it doesn't have a story. And so far, the PSP version is the only one that has an actual story. BTW, the PSP version has a 3rd-person perspective whereas the PS2 version uses the more traditional overhead perspective.

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a920e463687264ec000e8e#post_55a920e463687264ec000e8e
A man was abducted by an UFO for only using a telescope, and then I noticed a man got fat. Then it hit me.
_That guy was pregnant._
I was expecting a human baby. Still wasn't disappointed.
And that's when I stopped playing.

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a9215963687237f1002ac8#post_55a9215963687237f1002ac8

Alien abductions are just one of the many broken aspects in Sims. I get a ship spawning on my property almost _every single night._ I can delete the ship so my Sims are safe, but it's still obnoxious.
Anon was me. Whoops.

topics.body: Once, I made a male Sim for the sole purpose of sleeping and making children with every single female in town.I put him on free will. He went to the park and, with absolutely no direction from me, proceeded to bang every single female in the vicinity in the Sims' version of the Tardis. Sisters and mothers disappeared. It was glorious.
